Reading and Writing Center

Monday through Thursday
5pm to 8pm
First Floor in the Learning District or Basement, room 005C

Make an Appointment at http://fsu.mywconline.com.

This location takes appointments and walk-ins, but walk-ins can only be accommodated if there is a consultant available at the time. To ensure you get the help you need, we encourage you to make an appointment.

Please Note:The most up-to-date information on sites, hours, and appointments will be found on the official RWC homepage. Please verify details on this site if you have any questions.

Online Tutoring

Back to top

Access Online Tutoring

Become a Tutor

Back to top

Learning District Tutors: Chemistry, Math, and Physics

Current Openings: We are currently hiring in PHYSICS for FALL 2022. Multi-subject tutors are always a plus!

Are you an undergraduate tudent who is a whiz in math, physics, or chemistry?

Do you have a desire to share your knowledge with other FSU students?

If so, you should apply to be a Learning District tutor today! The Learning District provides walk-in, late-night peer tutoring for all FSU students courtesy of University Libraries. Tutor pay is currently $14 per hour.

Qualifications:

  • A 3.0 GPA or better on all college-level coursework
  • Ability to uphold all FSU Academic Honor policies and standards
  • Have taken and passed (with a B or better) all of the classes listed below for the subject area in which you are applying to tutor:

Chemistry

Earned grades B or higher in courses up to CHM2211 or higher

Math

Earned grades B or higher in courses up to MAC2312 or higher

Physics

Earned grades B or higher in courses up to PHY2054 or higher

Please submit:

  • Most recent unofficial transcript
  • A recommendation from a professor, TA, or research faculty in the subject area in which you are applying to tutor (click to view and download the faculty recommendation form)
  • A resume (optional)

Tutoring Resources

Back to top

Academic Support at FSU

Tutoring, consultations, and services at FSU. Academic Center for Excellence (ACE), Center for Academic Retention & Enhancement (CARE), Reading-Writing Center (RWC).

Online Learning Resources

The FSU Libraries' popular literature collection can be found next to Starbucks in Strozier Library.

Readiness Review Series

The FSU Libraries regularly consult with the Faculty Senate Library Committee about upcoming projects and strategies.

Academic Center for Excellence

The Academic Center for Excellence (ACE) is a university learning center, focused on helping students develop the study skills and success habits that are necessary in a large research university and valued by future employers. Their program is located on the ground floor of the William Johnston Building.

ACE offers the following services: Learning Studio Appointments and Group Tutoring sessions in multiple subject areas, Drop In Math Tutoring, Study Skills Tutoring, Personal Academic Consultations (PAC), and more.

To schedule a tutoring appointment, visit ace.fsu.edu/learning-studio, call 850.645.9151, or use the Campus Connect icon at in your My FSU portal.

Reading Writing Center (RWC)

The Florida State University Reading-Writing Center and Digital Studio offers writing and digital literacy support to all FSU students, undergraduate and graduate, across all disciplines. The RWC offers individualized instruction in composition and reading through one-to-one tutoring and small group workshops, helping students develop their writing in many areas. Students may make appointments or walk-in for assistance, and locations include the Williams Building, Strozier Library, and the William Johnston Building.

To schedule an appointment or to get more information, please visit the RWC Website. You can also call the RWC at 644-6495 before 6pm or visit fsu.mywconline.com. 

CARE

The CARE Tutoring & Computer Lab provides encouragement and support that will enhance each students' academic success. The Lab provides academic support in small groups and individualized sessions. The staff are prepared to assist students in developing effective study skills, review materials to explore learning styles, develop self confidence in course work and reduce feelings of fear and failure. Please visit their website for additional information.

Biology Help Rooms

Biology Teaching Assistants are available to assist students enrolled in BSC 1005. The Center is located in Milton Carothers Hall (MCH), room 425. Hours TBA.

The Biology Major Study Center in the King Building (KIN1054) is staffed by undergraduate tutors for BSC 2010 and BSC 2011. Free tutoring is provided for any student enrolled in either of these two courses, Monday – Friday 9am to 4:30pm, with the current term's weekly schedule posted on the door.

Chemistry Help Room

Chemistry Teaching Assistants are available to assist students enrolled in CHM 1045/6 & CHM 2210/11. The Center is located in the Chemistry Help Room (DLC 321C).

Economics Help Room

The Economics Help Desk, located in Bellamy 205, offers free walk-in tutoring in the following courses:

  • ECO2000: Introduction to Economic Thinking
  • ECO2013: Principles of Macroeconomics
  • ECO2023: Principles of Microeconomics

FSU Panama City Campus

All tutoring takes place in the Center for Academic Excellence & Innovation in HAC B101-102, located on the ground floor of the Holley Building OR through the Academic Center for Excellence (ACE) in Tallahassee via online skype sessions.
